page.name: Fisheries
page.title: Model coverage and general information
page.description:
Fish resources play multiple roles in the world's economies and societies. Fish are collected for subsistence, recreational, and commercial purposes. The global value of fish resources per year was estimated at 52 billion USD considering only the traded fish in 1997.

At the same time, fish stocks around the globe are in great danger due to overfishing and the habitat destruction due to climate change and pollution. This state of affairs demands better understanding of the way people use fish resources and of the actual (monetary and non-monetary) values connected to these resources, to allow for sustainable planning of their use.

This module collects all the fisheries-related storylines that have been defined in ARIES and can be applied to the region of interest you have identified. As new models are added to ARIES, new storylines will appear and more options will be given for scenario analysis.
